sections.1_story: Imagine you deposit money in a bank and want to know how much extra you will earn after a year. Simple interest helps you calculate your earnings easily for exams and real life.

ğŸ’¡ Principal (P): The original sum of money lent or invested.
ğŸ’¡ Rate (R): The percentage of interest per year.
ğŸ’¡ Time (T): The period for which money is lent or invested, usually in years.
ğŸ’¡ Amount (A): The total money after adding interest to principal (A = P + SI).
ğŸ’¡ Interest: The extra money paid for using someone else's money.
ğŸ’¡ Annual Interest: Interest calculated for one year.
ğŸ’¡ Half-yearly: Calculated for six months.
ğŸ’¡ Quarterly: Calculated for three months.
ğŸ’¡ Rate per annum: Rate of interest per year.

5_exam_examples.question: Find SI on Rs. 2000 at 6% per annum for 3 years.
If SI=150, P=1000, T=3 years, find R.
If SI=180, R=9%, T=2 years, find P.
If SI=120, P=800, R=6%, find T.
Find amount after 2 years on Rs. 1500 at 8% SI.
Find SI for 6 months on Rs. 1200 at 10%.
Find SI for 90 days on Rs. 500 at 12%.
If SI=200, R=5%, T=4 years, find P.
If SI=90, P=600, R=3%, find T.
Find SI on Rs. 2500 at 7% for 1.5 years.
